Title: A Postcard from Aveyron 

In the village of Aveyron, a snapshot taken in the South-west,
Beyond Brexit's blight and world-horror 's unrest, 
We find peace in wine-stained lips and baguette crumbs,
Gazing upon a canvas, applied by time's gentle thumb,
It's a simple relief in the European caress,
A reminder of the innate desire, to simply rest.
